author: seedstars
title: Accelerator: Cardano Startups
description: Developers in emerging markets who want to build on Cardano don't have the business skills necessary to build and scale their business. They also don't know that Cardano partners with accelerators.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem raised is that developers want to build startups on the Cardano blockchain but don't have the business skills needed to build and scale their businesses. If this problem can be solved, this is really a potential customer group because it is the development trend of the world.
f6_assessments.q1:
The solution raised is to conduct the Seedstars Impact Investment Readiness program to further support developers who want to build startups on the Cardano blockchain. Developers in emerging markets will be further encouraged to join the Cardano ecosystem and build on top of the Cardano blockchain. The proposal outlines progress and milestones along with specific work to be completed. It really impressed me because it was very detailed, specific, and professional.
The project's core team consists of 5 people: Zeb Hastings - Seedstars Project Manager, who coordinates Seedstars' projects and capacity-building programs focused on growing startups in emerging markets. Daria Markova is an entrepreneur and an experienced Founder, Daria has experience in training and coaching startups. Konstantin Hapkemeyer assumes the position of Investment Analyst / Funding Manager. Konstantin is a venture capitalist focused on early-stage startups in emerging markets. Maria Camila Albornoz assumes the position of Brand & Communications Director. Maria Camila is a designer, marketer, and communicator, with international experience in media, digital marketing, and project management. Ratko Ivanovic is an IT Specialist and Support Specialist. Thus, looking at the experience and education of the core team of the proposal, we see that the team is fully capable of ensuring a successful project launch. The proposed risks are that not enough entrepreneurs are interested in the program, participants are reluctant to research online, experts and advisors involved in the program are not fully engaged and committed, and finally, there are joint ventures with very specialized training needs corresponding to the specifics of the country/industry. However, they have outlined measures to reduce these risks in quite a detail.
f6_assessments.q2: The total required budget is 100000$, which is a suitable budget to launch a support project for developers who want to build startups on the Cardano blockchain. In addition, the budget is explained in detail, specifically for each project item, showing that the proposed calculation group is very close to reality. Furthermore, the proposal includes specific indicators, monthly progress and a KPI tracker to track the project's progress in a very detailed and professional manner. Conclusion: The project is financially transparent.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the feedback! Happy to see the interest.

f6_assessments.q0:
(vPAs, please note that this duplicate proposal has been referred to IOG for filtering, however at this point both proposals remain.  This assessment is being submitted to both and may be self-similar if one of the proposals is not removed.  Thanks for your consideration.)  The first thing we need to get into is alignment with the challenge setting.  There is an assumption that "development" means "coding", but a better description would be that it means "specialized knowledge for creating things".  Obviously in Cardano most things are built from code, so coding and development become synonymous, but we should also be considering the parts of this challenge that target "support" for those who would build in this ecosystem, and in particular, this statement from the Challenge Brief: "There would be a bigger talent pool of developers that Catalyst projects can collaborate with and turn project concepts/Proof of concept into successful protocols..."  This is where seedstars comes into alignment with this challenge, by building up start up ventures with training and tools to be better applicants to Catalyst, better targets for seed funding, and better able in general to articulate and achieve their potential.

The seedstars platform itself leverages an interesting algorithm that they use to help ventures create an "Investment Readiness Score" (and by proxy, they have training for investors to help them structure an investment based on using the score as well).  The score creates a data driven approach for proposers to structure a venture and its KPIs in a way that increases the likelihood of success.  On this note, there was one area of the proposal where I would have appreciated more clarity, (and since the team indicates they will be approaching Catalyst again in the future I hope they pursue this) I would love to see a list of the current graduates of the Blockchain challenge, and just generally any data supporting the impact the Fund7 proposals had, which are identical to these ones.  I was able to dig into their website and find 5 finalists (though the proposal indicates there were 12 across 2 accelerators), one of which I recognized as a successful Catalyst endeavor (Snapbrilia) but the rest were ??  For a project that leans into data driven decision making, it is an unfortunate oversight here that such key performance indicators were not succinctly organized and presented so that voters could better inform their own decision.  What has been the impact on Catalyst or Cardano from this venture?

While the lack of metrics to show how impactful this project has been cause me to lower the rating by one star, I do believe, just as I did in Fund7, that they have described a proposal that could provide excellent tooling and resources to those building on Catalyst and Cardano, and so I give it 4 stars for Impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is literally zero doubt that this team can deliver this product.  They have spent 9 years developing and delivering their principles and methods, and they had 100s of applicants to their previous events for the Blockchain challenge.  The description for this iteration doesn't seem to have varied at all except that the team has added a few new faces.

What they describe here is an extremely detailed series of onboarding workshops, indepth mentoring and training, and an elegant measurement algo that helps connect all these elements together into an integrated vision for each venture to pursue full realization of its potential, and to shine the best light on them as attractive investments.

The budget and timeline were clear, but may benefit from added granularity.  That they successfully concluded the previous round with similar budget numbers (the only real difference I spotted was the addition of a $15k administrative budget that seems targeted at an advisory role in Catalyst) is a good indicator that these numbers are accurate, and they certainly seem fair to me.  They clearly state that this is a 4 month funding cycle, 1 month for setup and 3 for running the challenge and finalizing the results, and every milestone they note is also a deliverable.

Because of they have provided proof of the work done to date, and show a deep engagement and understanding of the ins and outs of the project and its goals, I believe this is a project with high likelihood of success, and give it a full 5 stars for Feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given that one of the key principles of this project is to help innovators pin down projects to measurable goals and outcomes, you would expect them to put together a good list of KPIs and they haven't disappointed.  The list of milestones doubles well as a series of deliverables over the course of the four months, far more than is needed to populate the monthly progress reports.

The team has made themselves available in ATHs and some swarm meetings, and due to the nature of their project, they have a dedicated part of the team for communicating with the community.  As well they seem to be in close collaboration with Catalyst advisors as well, so there is an expectation that transparency and availability won't be an issue.

One place where I think their metrics could be improved, and my statement under Impact touches on this, is that they include success metrics here regarding the 12 proposers attending and completing the workshops...which are great progress metrics, but success for this project is something else.  If I may make a recommendation, it would be nice to see a set of sub-metrics for these graduates that indicate how many proposals they have submitted to Catalyst, what kinds of rankings these proposals earned from assessors, what their voting results and approval ratings they receive are, and finally the $amount of funding they receive from Catalyst (it is important those last two are treated separately, due to approval and funding being two separate metrics in Catalyst).  An accelerator should be measured by whether applicants gain an advantage over their peers in an ecosystem, and in Catalyst, that means innovation funding.  Alternatively, if graduates receive investment from another source, a metric should be included to indicate any investment captured for ventures building on Cardano.

Because the progress reporting metrics are strong and the team makes themselves accountable to the community, I believe this project has a strong auditability component that will keep it on track.  However I am reducing auditability by one star due to a lack of metrics which accurately measure the impact, indeed the success, of the project.  4 Stars.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your feedback! Really great to see your particular note regarding further information on recent graduates, something we are taking into account. Thanks!

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea of having a start up accelerator for companies that wants to build upon Cardano enviroment is really good and may facilitate a lot the adoption of this blockchain, specially improving the business model sustainability of these emerging companies, considering that a lot of developers who want to have a company still dont have the right capabilities. Having said that, it totally fits the challenge, addressing kpis such as "Number of developers actively building on top of Cardano" and going into the potential direction of "Support and Incentivization structures", as this may motivate and prepare better the future entrepeneurs who are still insecure and dont have yet the necessary skills.

Regarding the proposal itself, its imporant to highlight that it is very well strucutured, complete and articulated. It presents in a very good level of details how the acceletation program will work, in staged mannersm provides information regarding its communication and engagement strategy for most of the involved parts (startups and investors) and has a good risk management strategy. The course modulus/syllabus is also available, making it easier to understand what the focus will be. A video explaining what seedstar is also posted here.
The only detail I'd add here is more information on the results of the F7 funded proposals in Catalyst, to better understand their impact so far in Cardano ecosystem. This, however, do not compromise proposal quality and my rate is 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
Proposal presents a brieftimeline telling basically how long it will take both phase 0 and 1 and the main deliverablesmilestones at the end of the whole project. While I consider the delverables really clear, the timeline itself could have more information. There are plenty of subtask in both project phases that could be better brokendown and ellaborated in a time-framed manner.
Budget breakdown is sensible and matches project scope and plan. it could, though, include the total time necessaqry to develop each of the itens it is broken down into, at least in a high-level way.
Regarding the team, it has 5 committed people from Seedstart with a diverse background and capabilities that look like to be enough to run this project. A good description is provided for each person but linkedin or references links could also be provided. Other suggestion would be to make clearer here the experience with Cardano of these team. By what is descriibed, the only mentioned experience is from the project manager. However, going into the funded proposals from other rounds, its possible to see that other people here were in the team as well. For future proposals, I'd make this information more explicit so voters and PA can understand this right away.
Project seems generally feasible but my rate is 4 mainly because of my comments in the timeline part.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has very clear and good milestones and kpis. All these kpis already have a proposed target set which helps a lot to assess project success after completition. I also liked a lot that these kpis are divided by phase and the feedbacks and NPS is already taken into account. The only information I'd add here is how they intend to communicate these information (social media, their website, github) but this a minor detail. The auditability of this project is very well built, covers most of the perspectives of success and makes it really easy to track progress and verify success. My rate is therefore 5.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the feedback! Noted that we could include further information on timeline and our staff's previous experience with Cardano - very useful!

f6_assessments.q0: Seedstars has proposed the Accelerator program for Cardano startups to provide support to developers who want to build startup on the Cardano blockchain. It is a 3 month mentorship program giving the right tools and strong sense of community. It will be done in 2 phases with phase 0: screen and select and phase 1: capacity building and networking.  The proposal says that they provide building and growing business supports to developers and developers will be more inclined to join Cardano and build on Cardano blockchain. The proposal should aim more towards developers and mention how this proposal is exclusively for Cardano once the startups are selected and nurtured. The program components could have referred more about Cardano as it seems general that it could be applied to other blockchains. I agree that the proposal would have a positive impact towards Cardano developer community.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal lists detailed plan and milestones along with KPI metrics that will pivot according to their data. From its timeline and milestone, the proposal has not mentioned what would happen after the startups participating in their investment readiness program. The proposal could have given this information to attract more startups to participate in the program and to differentiate themselves from the other mentorship courses. The budget will be spent mostly on this investment readiness program $47,000 out of $100,000 requested budget. Yet, the proposal does not say how much is the readiness program flat fee and how they charge for each bootcamps and sessions. The seedstars team members that will work on the project (one of which is a funded proposer in fund 7) but the proposal doesn't share their bio link or any credentials to back up.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has not directly specify what the monthly milestones are during the 3 months period which will help for project's auditability. Project progress will be shared on their monthly submission and regular community meetings. They outline the  project tracker to be coincide with the feasibility section along with the metrics in each tracker. There are a few score terminologies that could have been clarified in the proposal. The examples are net promoter score (NPS) and investment readiness score. It is unclear how they calculate those scores and they specify one of metrics as 70+ Net promoter score. The information provided although is at some level sufficient, the proposal could  define their terminology more effectively to help in auditing for this project. They already run similar proposals in fund 7-accelerator in emerging markets and acceleration program in Africa and could use these 2 acceleration programs as the guideline on how to showcase their success in auditability section.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the feedback! Great suggestion re. including more info tailored to Cardano specifically, not just blockchain generally.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer proposes to conduct the Seedstars Impact Investment Readiness program to provide further support to developers who want to build startups on the Cardano blockchain. The Seedstars have had some success in the fund7 regarding similar proposals and now want to spread their wings and support many newer startups and entrepreneurs. This could bring in a lot of new developers to the chain and encourage them to build their applications on the chain in turn driving the Cardano value and adoption to a whole new level. The entire screening and selection process will include a lot more people than the selected ventures, hence spreading the information about Cardano and its capabilities at a global level. The proposal also includes a stage of training and mentoring these entrepreneurs, therefore, improving the quality of the applications built. The author, aware of all possible challenges in their path, has made enough efforts to identify the mitigation policies. Hence, the overall impact this endeavor could have is immense.
f6_assessments.q1: The entire game plan of the team is roughly divided into two phases and the author provides clear milestones associated with both of these phases separately. The milestones are all quantifiable metrics and they all align and work towards the final success metrics defined, thus making the evaluation of the proposal also easier. The budget even though looks like a huge amount to the bare eyes, upon closely observing the breakdown, is justified and practically necessary. Each of the sections of their strategy has been provided its own allocation of funding making sure there is sharp division and no mix-ups. All these points are optimistically adding points to the feasibility section. The team members have been active members of the community for some time and the experience of each one of them is commendable. Moreover, the team has had success in their previous proposals and are returning for more funds, hence the team is credible and trustworthy in many sense, thus making the feasibility metrics complete.
f6_assessments.q2: Taking a close look at the auditability metrics of the proposal, there seems to be enough evidence provided by the author to monitor the progress of the project. The monthly progress and KPI tracker aligned with the project plan and the author intend to submit these reports on a regular basis and through community meetings. The individual KPIs are mentioned against each of the phases and have a definite figure against each of them to make it easier for the auditors to evaluate if the milestone was reached or not. The total number of entrepreneurs attending sessions and finally who graduate from the Investment Readiness Score Program will be the final measure to evaluate the success of the proposal. The final metrics of 12 startups graduating on the final day and 70+ Net Promoter Score (NPS) score on the program will indicate success/failure. With such ample metrics available and support from the team to audit, the progress through regular reports and updates should make the auditing very straightforward and prolific.
f6_assessments.reply: Really great to see your enthusiastic feedback; thank you!

f6_assessments.q0: This is a potential proposal, it is the successor to the 2 accelerators funded at fund7. It provides professional startup support to startups (through Seedstars programs). Developers know how to grow, but may not be experts at building and growing businesses. Providing this support to developers will make them more engaged and building on the Cardano Blockchain more. Since then, many new products have been built on top of Cardano, fueling the ever-growing Cardano ecosystem. Because of the above reasons, I believe that this project will effectively solve the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
A detailed roadmap has been given, which is divided into 2 phases and lasts for 4 months. I am very impressed with the activities/services of the project. They are very detailed and complete, making it easy for people to visualize what activities and work you will do. The budget allocation has been provided, you have calculated quite specifically. However, you can also add clarity by breaking down the budget. I have a few suggestions that might help: determine the number of people involved in each task, the number of hours worked, and so on. That will make the budget clearer and more transparent, helping people have confidence in the project.
Team information has been provided. Your team consists of 5 members, they include: entrepreneur, investment analyst, brand & communication director, IT specialist,.... Based on the information provided, they have sufficient knowledge, experience and skills to undertake this project. However, it would be better if you provide a link to their profile (linkedin, telegram, ...). This will make team information more transparent. With the information about the team provided, I have full confidence that they are capable of carrying out this project with ease.
Also, I commend you for identifying the risks, challenges and ways to mitigate them. They are quite detailed and complete. That will be a solid basis for the long-term development of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
You did a great job in this section. Criteria for assessing project progress and success have been provided, which include specific numbers. Having specific numbers is essential, it will make it easy for everyone to compare and evaluate. At the same time, progress reports will be shared with the Cardano community through monthly submissions and through regular community meetings. This will be a channel to provide information for everyone, so that they can easily check and evaluate the progress, making the progress of the project more transparent.
The information provided is completely enough for anyone to judge the success of the project. This is a big project, bringing great value to the community. If successfully implemented, it will bring start-up opportunities for young entrepreneurs and businesses. Besides it will attract a lot of entrepreneurs, businesses and especially developers to Cardano. From there, they will build more on Cardano, fueling the ever-growing Cardano ecosystem. Based on the positive effects it brings, I hope in the future it will be implemented successfully. Thank you for this great suggestion!

f6_assessments.q0: There are many good Startups who have good knowledge over technicality but have less knowledge of Entrepreneur skills, so they find hard improving their business skills and using the benefits provided by other accelerators. Hence to overcome such scenario proposer has come up with Seedstars Impact Investment Readiness program to provide further support to developers who want to build startups on the Cardano blockchain which focuses on implementing experimental, data-driven methodologies and a mentor network available to increase entrepreneurs competitiveness, hence by conducting such methods more startups will attract towards cardano development, so that it can enhance the cardano community even more without any fear for startup , Hence this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposed task is never a difficult one to achieve where it just needs a good team who can teach and improve the entrepreneur skills of startup teams, the proposed task of teaching will be online mode,where setting up online meeting is never a difficult task in current world scenario, the team wants  focuses on implementing experimental, data-driven methodologies and a mentor network available to increase entrepreneurs efficiency.
The proposer's team has been over 1,150 mentors, and over 7 years of working with startups in emerging markets so that they can understand the challenges that they face and connect them with the best experts to help with their growth & impact. with such experienced team provided and minimal risk involved plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit clearly has presented the experience of Seedstars team in developing the entrepreneurial skills of new startups, it has also displayed its proven experience from fund 7 where this project is continuation of it . The audit has displayed proposed solution in very much detailed manner where it involves, boot camp, mentorship, hot topics etc and it has even mentioned about the modules which are to taught on priority.
The audit has even lined up the risks that in very detailed manner , where it shows the proposer's team has great pre planning skill to make project still more efficient , With well structured timeline and detailed budget breaking idea, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Entrepreneurism should be the main attraction to the Cardano Catalyst Community. Knowing the wide entrepreneurism opportunities Cardano Catalyst offers for their active members might be the cornerstone of a massive developers onboarding. But developers often lack business skills and they stick to their job. Enhancing entrepreneurism and business skills in developers might promote interest in Cardano blockchain and its unique Developer Ecosystem. Helping them to learn the Cardano blockchain code is also fundamental. Outreaching newcomers in a proactive way is what Cardano Catalyst needs in order to continue growing and developing their Developer Ecosystem. This three-month online mentorship program could be the very first step of a long-term educational strategy that enhances Cardano Catalyst dynamics, projects and transactions. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge of enhancing the Cardano Catalyst Developer Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Seedstars has been working for the past nine years in entrepreneurs emerging markets and have built a close relationship with the Cardano Community, achieving funding for already three successful proposals in Fund7. This high - calibre team are widely experienced and they already are well acquainted with Cardano Catalyst internal dynamics and timelines. This should be a guarantee of a successfully implemented proposal. Nevertheless, key milestones presented are detailed and consistent in a realistic timeline. Budget breakdown is clear and down to earth. Having a 0 Phase where they will develop a research strategy and gather needs assessment of the selected participants seems to be the cornerstone of a successful implemented educational proposal that will certainly address the real needs of its students. Knowing the continuous work Seedstars is doing in alliance with the Cardano Catalyst Community is a guarantee of their commitment and engagement with our community’s challenges in the long term.
f6_assessments.q2: Having previous experience in funded proposals Seedstars have already developed efficient communicational channels that will certainly make auditability easy and efficient. Sharing progress in monthly submissions and on regular meetings will be sufficient to audit the progress of the proposal. KPIs tracker will be measured on a regular basis. Specific metrics have been outlined for the success measurement once the app and the online program is finished and delivered. It might be interesting for the proposal to run a feedback survey once the program is finished and compare initial with final student feedback, this might help the program improvement and Seedstars educational efficiency.
f6_assessments.reply: Great feedback to read - thank you!

solution: This will be a successor to the 2 accelerators funded from F7 to include more startups building on Cardano. Through this, we can support more businesses who want to build on the Cardano blockchain.
experience: For 9 years, Seedstars has supported emerging market entrepreneurs across 75 countries, supporting 37k+ entrepreneurs, delivering trainings for 2k+, and investing in 75 high-growth companies. We have an established relationship with Cardano, winning 3 projects in Fund 7.
